title: "Impossible to balance."

replies.body:
riot is lazy and doesn't want to confront any of the real issues with these champions

it's the same shit that they had with {{champion:38}} where they just ignored the real problem because it was 'central' to their kit, their theme, etc

{{champion:268}} 's early game is too good and his burst is too high if he's supposed to be DPS. lower his Q's damage drastically and then lower the cooldown so he can use it to constantly reposition soldiers late game  instead of being focused on just dumping as much burst as soon as he can 

{{champion:266}} change either his health costs to flat or his healing to % and bump his damage up. a bigger rework is certainly in order purely for thematic disconnect, but there's no reason to keep him unplayable until then

{{champion:90}}{{champion:72}}  revert

{{champion:82}} revert him but let me keep the W heal, it's pretty nice

{{champion:429}} {{champion:203}}  delete

{{champion:78}} give me old ult, i hate the new one and i'd consider poppy one of my go-to junglers right now

Poppy's old ult was the reason she was never allowed to actually be playable.

It was Riot's official policy that if Poppy ever actually saw pro play, or even a general rise in play rate to be honest, they would immediate nuke her kit from orbit. All because of her old ult. It's a pretty good indicator that the ability was horrifically toxic and will never be coming back.

I don't see why people don't like her new Ult, its extremely unique and not only is strong but is good in more ways than one, it can provide a fast knock-up to lock the target in place for a while and if used right can completely change a fight, I remember the first time I was playing her post rework, and I just fell in love with her ult after I send both their ADC and Support back to their base winning us the now 5 v 3 and securing the dragon, it can be used both defensively and aggressively and is still balanced.

its very simple.
what people want is this: 

I can go in on whomever i want on the other team and kill them
and the other team can't do shit about it. 

that's in a nut shell her old ult.
Yeah, whenever I see this kind of thing, I think "but what will you do when going AGAINST poppy?"
They never consider being on the receiving end.
Agreed with everything except Poppy. I think she was probably the best rework they ever did.

i think her kit is pretty nice but it doesn't really feel like poppy. i wanted a fresh take on a tough melee carry, not another tank. she's not even a bruiser, which just feels like an insult. of course, i play her as aggressive as possible, so her ult feels out of place in my rotation

also the fact that i mute her when i play as her because her voice and dialogue just makes me mad

Just my personal opinion here, but, Poppy's whole "feel" was the tanky small yordle girl that wasnt afraid to charge through an enemy team and slam a motherfucker into a wall. (Which they hit this thematic perfectly in the rework) but other than that Poppy really struggled to have a feel other than that. Her kit was too lop-sided( dis-arranged, is that the word?) kinda like a puzzle but with nothing but pieces that dont fit together. Her q was an AA enhancement, her w was a speed boost that was kinda actually pretty cool but ultimately confusing, and her E hasnt change, her old ult was toxic as fuck. She could just pick "Innocent Squishy 1", nullify the rest of their team, and slam them into a wall and kill them instantly. Her passive was also quite interesting in how it worked but still was confusing to me at least. Her kit lacked power, which made her pretty weak and nearly impossible to get through laning phase with. It was obvious she was just too weak until given time to use her ult. Her lore was great too as it set up another champion connection + her VA wasnt too bad for an old champ, but it was just she didnt work. Her new Q is way better, her new passive makes her actually able to do something in lane + have some sort of survivability, her e didnt change but overall works more cohesively with her new kit, and her new ult can either be used in solo targeting or saving your team (or the rare "kill secure")

Edit: WHOOPS MISSED THE POINT
In the end, I feel her rework actually established who she is as a character, and delivered a better feel of who she was in gameplay, without making her feel drastically different from old poppy. (In reality all that changed completely was her ult)
You forgot the part where old Poppy marked someone with either no damage, or no cc, ult them, then go ham on whoever they pleased.

I want to point this out again as an Ex-main because you cannot emphasize this enough!!!!
Agreed, they put all of his power into his passive then they gutted it without compensation

His original kit wasn't *perfect* but that doesn't justify a change becaus of "Game-Health"-issues.
They just tuned down his damage for a new passive and they could've done that on the old malz as well - which was genuinely more fun to play in my opinion.

Agreed. The new passive is basically worthless outside of the extremely late game anyway (with a 12sec CD), unless pit against a few specific champions who need to hit you with a spell, which doesn't move them, to engage...

Really, where they said he was changed for "Game Health" i'd argue he was one of the champions keeping the game in a healthy state. They couldn't release champions which push even more unhealthy gameplay because he would work as an easy to play, hard counter to their kit's powerful mobility.

And realistically, i know it hasn't been very long, but how many champions have they reworked/released which couldn't have been released with the old malzahar?

There are tons of uses for this ability , but it just doesn't fit as a passive.

I think they wanted to emphasize skill on Malzahar, which wasn't visible in his kit, because all he needed was excellent positioning to win a fight - and that always seemed unfair or useless once his ultimate was down.

Nevertheless a small *update*  isn't sufficient for the issues Malzahar has and for the potential he holds, if reworked correctly into a Dark Void-Mage (and not into the space-aids spreading Pokemon-Trainer )

Except his new passive really has no uses, unless the other play is too stupid to stagger for literally less than a second. 

It use to be useful as a delay tool, to ensure he had time to build his voidlings, but it doesn't even work as that anymore after the nerfs.

It's pretty easy to tell how much more depth the champion use to have, purely from the fact that he use to be built as AD or AP, and both played very different. 
The current version plays the same no matter what you build. The only reason he's even viable is because the terribly designed W.

I think new Malz has a lot of potential for being a really healthy champion (moreso than old Malz), but Riot really dropped the ball in the delivery... and the follow-up over the ensuing month of chaos after the mage update was no help.

I think that the old malz had better potential than the new version, except they had no idea what they wanted the champion to be. Which is a little weird considering how long he had his identity. 

I think it's more accurate to say that the riot staff just stopped liking his identity. Probably because he was one of the people which stopped them from pushing mobility creep even further
many pre-rework malz HATE this current shit show.

Thats because they liked building 2 items then doing a third of a target's HP with a single point and click ability. Not talking about his ult either

Old Malz was toxic as hell. New Malz has more counterplay and is still very viable

It would help if Riot stopped prioritizing "fun and unique" designs which are _only_ fun for the person playing the champion with no regard whatsoever going toward those who have to play with and against them.  This creates overloaded abominations like Yasuo, Kalista,  Ekko, Gnar, Thresh, and Kindred.

Edit: And then there's the problem with the reworks that missed the mark so much that the champion is hardly played anymore and the old mains don't see the champion they fell in love with anymore because the devs alienated and ignored them. Then there's the worst case scenario that there's a net gain in the popularity, the new mains will have the most useful positive feedback, and the rework will be deemed a success with nothing more to add than a shallow, meaningless "apology" to the original fans. 

It would help even more if Riot's dedicated defenders stop protecting obviously disastrous ideas just because their blind devotion outweighs common sense, and their militant fanboyism prevents them from understanding problems with game health since Riot hasn't directly stated there's an issue...

i dont think taliyah is impossible to balance. and i doubt they said that. shes mostly has the kit of a classic mage, and not any actual problematic mechanics.

they probably need to fiddle with her q a little bit to tune her waveclearing, so she has to work a bit more for opportunities to roam. but thats it. i really honestly doubt that she would need a larger rework.

if you really want to add someone to your list, then go with {{champion:72}} {{champion:82}} 

though, honestly i dont understand riots stance on skarner. just judging by winrate, he had been balanced for a really long time. the last big nerf felt like it came out of nowhere, when he was already sitting at 50% winrate for a while. maybe he was op in tournaments? i dont watch them, so i wouldnt know.

This is why I am really scared of the Warwick rework. Most of the reworks have been hit or miss and the way Skarner and Mordekhaiser have been left in is miserable. This is one of the reasons I wish Riot would stop pumping out new champs and give life to old ones and have healthy fun fantasies. So much potential in champs like Aatrox, Urgot, Galio, Kayle etc is being wasted and it looks like if they are not broken in some way they can't compete against the new ones.

Almost no matter what, the Warwick rework will be good because anything is better than the current one. 

He'll likely still have a suppression. Its pretty iconic for him. He'll also still likely have the whole drain-tank think going on. 

Nothing else will really be missed about Warwick. There's very little gameplay being removed if they take out his Q (which might still be included with his new kit) and W. His E will likely be passive somewhere in his kit, though it might be self-only vision, like Rengar's ult.

Tbh, Skarner isn't impossible to balance. They've just tried too hard to make him 'unique' when they could target other champions who fall flat on thematics and occupy a similar space. 

He'd be in a pretty good spot now if they'd remove spires and up his base mana regen, MS, and attackspeed a little bit. But they want him to be 'unique'. Its not a balance problem, its a Riot problem.

I'm an Aatrox main , for me he is balanced right now , although unpopular because of people misunderstanding him , imo . He can dominate a game if he takes few kills early , or is  useless if get's camped . The things he needs are : base AD buff , base HP pool + HP/lvl growth . He already has enough damage for me , but has problems with dealing that damage due to his extreme , for a toplaner ofc , squishiness . I have never understood , and will not never understand , why the hell they decided him to be as squishy as some ADC's .  

I never played Kalista but , I imagine that her strong points are kiting through her passive and her Rend passive . If someone would decide to put a limit on her passive and Rend passive , she would be playable again . Can't tell much about her . 

Azir for me needs to be reworked , a mage marksman with tons of mobility , poke damage and a powerful disengage tool is , imo , unhealthy for the game . 

Well , I don't understand why are you talking about Malz ... This champion is good in 5v5 teams . The only thing unbalancable about him are his pets and his aids  

Well , Kindred ... This is where i strongly agree , it's just a complete bullshit to give a marksman almost infinite scaling %HP damage , and a very good slow with even more %HP damage . This champ is impossible to balance . 

Imo , Rek'Sai's kit is well thaught and thus , overloaded . Don't have to say anything about her. 

And last , Taliyah . She was supposed to be a classic control mage but her kit is not designed for a classical control mage since , at release her waveclear was insanely fast and could roam if needed . That was unblanced , now she's sleeping with rocks .
Tbh I feel Taliyah is fine, and Kindred can still do very well.

These kinds of posts have been done before, especially during the last reworks.

However, I will add to the discussion by pointing out that my biggest issue with the aforementioned champions is that they no longer feel good to play.

For example, Kindred was supposed to be a leaping archer.  Now when I play her I constantly feel like my Q isn't quite up in time when I need it, and the heal on charge up system for W was a lot more interesting as a mechanic than crippling jungle camps.  Same can be said of Skarner and the spire passive.  I love Skarner as a champion, I still don't understand the spires.  If I could at least choose where to place them thus adding some strategy to it they would be easier to digest, but as they stand they just take time away from doing other things on the map while telling the enemies where you are.

Beyond that it's no fun when a champion you are trying to learn is changed on a weekly basis.  I hardly recognize Azir anymore, and I briefly played Ekko when he came out because I was interested in the character.  Well, Ekko has been through several iterations of number changes and then tank Ekko, so if I went back to him now I wouldn't even know where to begin.

I hope they take into consideration how fun a champion is to play and how it feels to play.  Objective of the game is to have fun after all (at least for the average player base who are not playing for money in the LCS).

some of these champions aren't even hard to balance

sometimes a champion or item is nerfed into the ground because they create unfun experiences for everyone involved. perfect example is devourer. not a single person liked having a devourer jungler on their team, and not a single person liked having a devourer jungler on the enemy team

the only difficulty in balance is usually between competitive and casual play, which is where most balance nightmares like azir, reksai, kalista, lissandra, taliyah, sivir, poppy, alistar, etc. come from.

this list lacks yasuo

It is REALLY hard for them though, and we can't ignore that. They have to balance champions for high elo and low elo, NA play styles and EU play styles, for the Mastery 7 players of the champion and the noobs, for the players with crazy good mechanics and the player without, and the list goes on and on and on. While Riot could possible be better with the balancing, we have to cut them some slack and realize hey, this is really hard for them.

Its funny how no one even mentioned {{champion:44}}.

Champion who got good playrate, fitted his theme, was fun to those that played him and had strong niche - anti ad support with anti mobility tool.

I feel like his rework was overdone, all he needed was new mechanic or two and new ult (but not this delayed thing he got now) on top of visual update that keept him as close to original design as possible. They tried to hard and in the end created a new champion.

Right now he is balanced around his best case scenario - a possibility to 5-man ult, 5-man stun, 5-man heal - that makes him feel extremally dull and boring. 
He lost his theme - look at his splash and tell me you see a paladin there - he is one big mess of stars, beauty, protector, mountain, demigod, gems, cleric and Fabio, bc wandering gem knight was not unique enough.
He lost the warmth in his voice - now is all about "Me" and "I":
"That glimmer of hope you see, that's me."
"I climbed Mount Targon. You suck."
"The stars were the question. I was the answer."
Why is he even scaling with armor if he wears none?

All in all i have to agree with him - "Im no longer the man i once was." :(

The new Taric could be a pretty solid champion if they just removed his heal and gave him a real Q.
He'd be even better if they removed his stupid ult and gave him something actually fun to use. Even his old ult was more interesting than this garbage.

Honestly though he would be better served if they just reverted him to before he got gutted in pre-season 3, which only happened because his pick rate was unusually high in the pro play meta more than 6 months prior. He wasn't even a meta pick anymore when the nerfs hit, and he was only meta in the first place because he was the only thing that could compete with Sona at the time. Taric received the singlemost crippling nerf in any patch in the history of the game, just because. He was strong, but not overpowered, he saw his fair share of play but wasn't overpopular. He was as close to perfectly balanced as any single champion could get, and the item changes were already weakening him while buffing some of his competition.
People always bring up Olaf or Evelynn when talking about overzealous nerfs that permanently ruin a champion, but in a single patch nobody has ever received numerical nerfs harsher than Taric has, no one has ever received as many nerfs to different parts of their kit as Taric has, and nobody has ever been nerfed with less justification than Taric has. And the most frustrating part is that nobody even remembers it. Nobody raised a fuss about the change. Nobody noticed that Taric suddenly just stopped existing. The whole event was just ignored and forgotten.
